title: IOS 18
content: {{AFC submission|d|v|u=2600:6C50:75F0:19D0:54E6:4025:456D:423B|ns=118|decliner=Qcne|declinets=20231223210855|ts=20231223210405}} {{AFC comment|1=[[WP:TOOSOON]] '''[[User:Qcne|Qcne]]''' [[User talk:Qcne|(talk)]] 21:08, 23 December 2023 (UTC)}} ---- {{Short description|apple operating system}} {{Draft topics|software|computing|technology}} {{AfC topic|other}} {{lowercase title}} {{Draft article|subject=media}} {{Infobox OS | name = iOS 18 | logo = | logo size = | logo caption = | logo alt = | screenshot = | caption = | screenshot_alt = | collapsible = | version of = [[iOS]] | developer = [[Apple Inc.]] | family = [[iOS]] | working state = | source model = [[Proprietary software|Closed]] with [[open-source software|open-source]] components | released = | discontinued = | RTM date = | GA date = | latest release version = | latest release date = | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | repo = | marketing target = [[iPhone]]s | programmed in = | language = | language count = | language footnote = | update model = [[Software Update]] | package manager = | supported platforms = | kernel type = | userland = | ui = | license = | preceded by = [[iOS 17]] | succeeded by = | website = | support status = | other articles = }} '''iOS 18''' is the 18th and upcoming major release of the iOS mobile operating system developed by Apple for its iPhone line of products. It will be revealed at WWDC 2024, following tradition of iOS reveals. It will fully support devices that are running on [[Apple A15 Bionic|A15 Bionic]] and later, while the devices will have limited support that are running on [[Apple A13|A13 Bionic]] and [[Apple|A14 Bionic]]. ==Supported devices== ===Limited Support=== [[iPhone 11]] [[iPhone 11 Pro]]/Max [[iPhone SE (2nd generation)]] [[iPhone 12]]/mini [[iPhone 12 Pro]]/Max ===Fully Supported=== [[iPhone 13]]/mini [[iPhone 13 Pro]]/Max [[iPhone SE (3rd generation)]] [[iPhone 14]]/Plus [[iPhone 14 Pro]]/Max [[iPhone 15]]/Plus [[iPhone 15 Pro]]/Max === Older devices === [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] will be planning on dropping support for devices that runs on [[Apple A12 Bionic|A12 Bionic]] SoC. These include the [[iPhone XS]], iPhone XS Max, and [[iPhone XR]]. ==References== {{reflist}} {{S-start}} {{Succession box |title=iOS 18 |years=2024 |before=[[iOS 17]] |after= }} {{S-end}} {{Apple software}} {{Draft categories| [[:Category:IOS|*18]] [[:Category:2024 software]] [[:Category:Products introduced in 2024]] [[:Category:Mobile operating systems]] }}
